comments:
When trying to attach a mylar context to a bugzilla report I get the following exception.

java.io.IOException: The declaration for the entity "HTML.Version" must end
with '>'.
at
org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.ui.search.RepositoryQueryFactory.performQuery(RepositoryQueryFactory.java:123)
at
org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.ui.tasklist.BugzillaRepositoryConnector.queryForChanged(BugzillaRepositoryConnector.java:807)
at
org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.ui.tasklist.BugzillaRepositoryConnector.getChangedSinceLastSync(BugzillaRepositoryConnector.java:786)
at
org.eclipse.mylar.provisional.tasklist.SynchronizeQueryJob.run(SynchronizeQueryJob.java:84)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

I'm using 
Mylar 0.5.2 
Eclipse3.2RC6 
Windows XP Pro
Bugzilla 2.22 

Bugzilla is protected through a Digestauthentication
The fix for this will be in today's 0.5.3 release.
